subject: Web3
title: Cross-Chain DeFi
description: A quick win: understand Cross-Chain DeFi.

hook.text: DeFi started on Ethereum, but users wanted cheaper alternatives. Protocols expanded to Solana, Avalanche, and more.

buildup.text: Each blockchain had its own DeFi ecosystem. Moving assets between them required bridges â€” smart contracts linking chains.

discovery.text: Bridges unlocked multi-chain DeFi. Users could chase better yields across different blockchains.

twist.text: Bridges became DeFi's biggest targets. Hackers stole over $2 billion from bridge exploits in 2022 alone.

climax.text: Cross-chain DeFi expanded the ecosystem but created new attack surfaces. Connecting blockchains remains dangerous.

punchline.text: Bridges connect blockchains. Hackers noticed they're the weakest links.

quiz.question: Why are cross-chain bridges a security concern in DeFi?
options: They're prime targets for hackers, with billions stolen from exploits
